blog.name: sillyanshe
blog.title: Imagination take me somewhere I don't know
blog.description:
| Angie | Argentina | 24 | She/Her | Literature student |
House Stark. Rebel scum. Hufflepuff. Greek mythology lover. Sansa Stark defense squad. Salty winter adult. Fangirl with a lot of feelings. Icon by treasonforlove. Mobile header by ohbellamy. Sidebar gif by iheartgot.

summary: for the character tag game: each of the starklings
question: for the character tag game: each of the starklings
answer:
Robb - Beautiful Crime by Tamer. It’s heartbreaking and it fits the KINT Robb that goes to war.

Jon - After The Storm by Mumford & Sons. This song just screams Jon Snow to me. It fits his whole arc perfectly.

Sansa - I’ll do a 3x1 for her, basically because I can’t decide on just one. First off, I’m In Here by Sia. It captures the hopelessness of her time in KL. Second song is Landslide by Fleetwood Mac. This song is perfect for her, especially during her time in the Eyrie. And finally, Bird Set Free by Sia. It’s just perfect for her, after going through so much she regains her wings (and voice).

Bran - Nightcall by London Grammar. This song gives me strong TER vibes.

Arya - The Devil Within by Digital Daggers. This song was written for her.

Rickon - Somewhere Only We Know by Lily Allen (cover). A total tear-jerker, just as the thought of bb Rickon 💔


Send me a character and I’ll reply with a song that reminds me of them

This is my profile of all the things I love about Game of Thrones, Disney, Brother Bear, I ship it forever and couples that I like
And other things way more among my favorite things, such as art, cartoons, drawing, tv shows, etc.

summary: As a supporter of Breera I still ship Bran and Meera because in the show they had very good chemistry even if it wasn't shown...
body:
As a supporter of Breera I still ship Bran and Meera because in the show they had very good chemistry even if it wasn’t shown explicitly per say, Meera is a strong woman in her own way in the GOT universe and series. The whole thing went so fast but it still has good moments about these two that make the ship real. I’m just disappointed that the writers and directors didn’t care enough to say goodbye to Meera from the show, it’s like it was: “You were good from season 4 to 7 but we’re gonna cut you off right there, bye.” Yes I understand the whole Bran wasn’t Bran anymore he’s the 3eyed raven emo boy now so deal with it; it would’ve been out of character moment of he showed some emotion. It just made me a bit sad to see how they ruined his story and made him look the villain at the end. (Bran is still my favorite male character next to Tyrion). Was suprised to see Edmure and Robin in the finale but no Meera or Howland? Too many budgets to cut the directors we’re probably thinking. Anyway getting back to the point, Bran and Meera were one of the most purest GOT couples that didn’t involve backstabbing or betrayal but it did end bad; they will always be one of the best OTP, next to Sansa and Tyrion, Braime and Gendrya. Isaac is such a wonderful actor who doesn’t deserve hate from the fandom, neither does Kit or Emilia or Sophie.

Sorry for the rant. Good luck to all GOT couples. Breera is still canon.

If you have any thoughts on this please leave a comment.

blog.name: frazzledsoul
blog.title: I Am The Elephant In The Room
blog.description: Currently lost in the GoT AO3 fanfic archive.

summary:
Guys, I don't want to sound like an insane person . . .
. . . but there is no fucking way I believe that GRRM is going to...
body:
Guys, I don’t want to sound like an insane person …

… but there is no fucking way I believe that GRRM is going to institute Bran (the omniscient nature deity!) as king at the end of the book series. We could talk for days about how giving someone with unlimited magical power who has the ability to live for hundreds of years is a really horrible idea that goes against all of GRRM’s pacifist/antiwar views. I just don’t believe this happens. AT ALL.

Everything officially coming out of HBO is spin and I don’t think Isaac (or anyone else they interview) is in control of what they have to say. HBO also has a vested interest in promoting the GoT ending as the “true” narrative, whether they got close or not. So this isn’t Issac’s fault. But I’m not trusting the secondhand information he’s putting out there right now.

Do I believe Bran becomes a powerful figure and ends up important in the end? Yes, absolutely. But either HBO or the showrunners are twisting the truth or GRRM was super cryptic about the details bbecause he hadn’t figured them out yet (shocker).

Of course, you can say I’m crazy and in denial, but … I’m just not buying this one. Sorry.

tags: jon is the king beyond the wall dont @ me
summary: Sometimes I remember how angry the ending of GoT makes me but then I think about the Stark kids arranging ‘political’ meetings...
body: Sometimes I remember how angry the ending of GoT makes me but then I think about the Stark kids arranging ‘political’ meetings between the Queen of the North, the King of the Six Kingdoms and the King Beyond the Wall just so they can chill out for a little while together.

reblog.comment: Sometimes I remember how angry the ending of GoT makes me but then I think about the Stark kids arranging ‘political’ meetings between the Queen of the North, the King of the Six Kingdoms and the King Beyond the Wall just so they can chill out for a little while together.
